msContents.summary: Pentateuch with punctuation and accents, Rashi's commentary,Targum with simple superlinear punctuation and Sa῾adia Gaon's Arabic translation.

msItem.title: Torah ʿim targum u-ferush Rash"i
תורה עם תרגום ופרוש רש"י

note.p: Second of the three uniform volumes of the Pentateuch, containing the books of Leviticus and Numbers.
The Pentateuch is accompanied by the pointed Targum, Rashi's commentary and Sa῾adia's Arabic translation.

msItem.filiation: Cf. Or 2228 and 2230, 183, for the first and the third volume of this commentary.

physDesc.p: Paper codex, Yemenite square and semi-cursive script of 17th century, partially punctuated.

foliation.p: 207 folios (+ 2 unfoliated paper flyleaves at the beginning and 3 at the end).

layoutDesc.layout:
Watermarks on , and on . The first watermark is a hand, the second watermark is a vase with a crescent at the top and a monogramm (CO?), similar to 3603 (dated to 1646, England).
Uniform layout.
The beginnings of the weekly sections marked by small pen and ink designs in the margins, other liturgical indications marked with Hebrew letters.
At the end of the weekly sections are the masoretic statements relating to the number of verses and simanim.

handDesc.summary: Yemenite square and semi-cursive script of 17th century, partially punctuated and accentuated. Yosef ben Se῾adya ben Yosef ben Daṿid: inscribed in the colophon in volume 1, Or 2228, folio 300v and volume 3, Or 2230, folio 110v.

additions.p: Se῾adya ben Daṿid: inscribed in volume 1, Or 2228, folio 300v.
Ḥayim ibn Yaḥya al-Ṭiri: inscribed with his name in volume 1, Or 2228, folio 1r.

acquisition.p: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 10 April 1880, folio [211v].

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.
